user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_bd_flush:
```c
static int lfs_bd_flush(lfs_t *lfs,
        lfs_cache_t *pcache, lfs_cache_t *rcache, bool validate) {
    if (pcache->block != LFS_BLOCK_NULL && pcache->block != LFS_BLOCK_INLINE) {
        LFS_ASSERT(pcache->block < lfs->block_count);
        lfs_size_t diff = lfs_alignup(pcache->size, lfs->cfg->prog_size);
        int err = lfs->cfg->prog(lfs->cfg, pcache->block,
                pcache->off, pcache->buffer, diff);
        LFS_ASSERT(err <= 0);
        if (err) {
            return err;
        }

        if (validate) {
            // check data on disk
            lfs_cache_drop(lfs, rcache);
            int res = lfs_bd_cmp(lfs,
                    NULL, rcache, diff,
                    pcache->block, pcache->off, pcache->buffer, diff);
            if (res < 0) {
                return res;
            }

            if (res != LFS_CMP_EQ) {
                return LFS_ERR_CORRUPT;
            }
        }

        lfs_cache_zero(lfs, pcache);
    }

    return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function lfs_bd_flush:
#define LFS_BLOCK_NULL ((lfs_block_t)-1)
...
#define LFS_BLOCK_INLINE ((lfs_block_t)-2)
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (validate) {
            // check data on disk
            lfs_cache_drop(lfs, rcache);
            int res = lfs_bd_cmp(lfs,
                    NULL, rcache, diff,
                    pcache->block, pcache->off, pcache->buffer, diff);
            if (res < 0) {
                return res;
            }

            if (res != LFS_CMP_EQ) {
                return LFS_ERR_CORRUPT;
            }
        }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No unreachable code is evident in the fragment as written. The guarded block is executed when the runtime boolean parameter 'validate' is true; there is no compile-time constant or preprocessor condition shown that would make this branch permanently unreachable. (A possible violation scenario would be if 'validate' were guaranteed false at compile time — for example if callers always pass false or if validate were effectively a compile-time constant 0 — which would render the whole block unreachable and thus violate Rule 2.1.)
